data.title: Reviews of Empire of the Ants
data.meta_description: Reviews of Empire of the Ants
data.text:
Another one in a long line of the Bert I. Gordon giant creature features and I will be honest I did enjoy this one more that I thought I would've. Granted it is still a pretty low budget movie and it does show that fact from time to time when it comes to use of the blue screen effects and the ants when they are practical effects are clearly just a head and a torso of an ant on a…

A dodgy real estate agent (Joan Collins) has a party of prospective buyers to inspect some land where properties will be built. Unfortunately, some goofballs have dumped radioactive waste nearby and a colony of ants has grown to the size of a Smart car ... each!

Silly low budget monster mash has a dogs dinner of a script and is filled with disaster movie-style squabbling characters served up as ant brunch. Bert I. Gordon's direction is barely competent, no more…

EMPIRE OF THE ANTS (1977)

Dir: Bert I. Gordon

The audience gets antsy long before "Ants," from the super-tacky Bert I. Gordon, does. Gordon, perhaps the only grade-Z sci-fi auteur left over from the Fifties (unless you count the sadly declining Ray Harryhausen), continues to besmirch the memory of H.G. Wells (he did last year's barfola "The Food of the Gods") with stupendously bad scripts, colossally inept special effects, and ambalmingly effective ennui.

Set in contemporary Florida, which always has…
